intro: Viguiera tuberosa var. guaranitica, commonly known as the Guaraní milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. It has a tuberous root system that helps it survive in arid conditions. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it an important plant in ecological systems.
